Positive: Acanthosis nigricans is a skin condition characterized by areas of dark, velvety discoloration in body folds and creases. Common symptoms include dark, thickened, and velvety skin in the armpits, groin, and neck. The affected skin may also have a bad odor or itchiness. Other symptoms may include skin tags in the affected areas, which are small, flesh-colored growths.
Negative: A person without acanthosis nigricans would not experience any dark, thickened, velvety skin in body folds and creases. They would not have skin tags in the armpits, groin, or neck. The skin of a person without acanthosis nigricans would not exhibit a bad odor or itchiness in these areas.
